name: disdainfully
content:

in a way that shows someone does not like someone or something and thinks that they do not deserve interest or respect: "Is this the best you have?" she asked disdainfully. They spoke disdainfully of their rivals. See
disdain
More examplesFewer examplesHe described the results disdainfully as "simply not credible".The socialite disdainfully surveyed her fellow-passengers.Some art critics sniffed disdainfully at the idea that a major museum should rent out its art.He tossed the paper disdainfully in the bin.
